# Call for Papers: ASE 2025

The IEEE/ACM International Conference on Automated Software Engineering (ASE) is the premier research forum dedicated to automated software engineering. ASE 2025 invites high-quality contributions that present significant, original, and unpublished results in the field. The conference aims to foster discussion on the foundations, techniques, and tools for automating the analysis, design, implementation, testing, and maintenance of large software systems.

## New Features for ASE 2025

*   **PC Self-nomination:** Researchers are invited to self-nominate to serve on the Program Committee via a dedicated form.
*   **Major Revisions:** Reviewers may request revisions, providing authors with a defined period to address feedback, with accepted papers subject to meeting specific criteria.
*   **Auto-bidding:** The Toronto Paper Matching System (TPMS) will be used to streamline paper bidding and assignment, enhancing reviewer expertise.
*   **Rapid Response Reviewers:** A dedicated group of PC members will be available to review papers on short notice to cover unexpected reviewer unavailability.

## Tracks and Submission Categories

ASE 2025 welcomes submissions across various tracks, including:

*   **Research Papers:** Describing innovative research in automating software development or support for software development activities.
*   **Journal-First Track:** For recent journal publications.
*   **Industry Showcase:** Highlighting industry applications and practices.
*   **NIER Track (New Ideas and Emerging Results):** For novel concepts and early-stage research.
*   **Tool Demonstration Track:** Showcasing practical tools.
*   **Workshops:** Proposals for specialized workshops.
*   **Doctoral Symposium:** For PhD students to present their work.
*   **New Faculty Symposium:** Supporting early-career faculty.
*   **Student Research Competition:** Encouraging student participation.
*   **Tutorials:** Offering educational sessions on relevant topics.

## Research Areas

Submissions are grouped into nine research areas:

1.  **Requirements and Design:** Requirements elicitation, management, traceability, software architecture, modeling, model-driven engineering, software product lines, component-based/service-oriented systems, object-oriented/aspect-oriented systems.
2.  **Testing and Analysis:** Regression, mutation, model-based testing, system/unit/integration testing, fuzzing, automated program repair, static/dynamic analysis, empirical program analysis.
3.  **Maintenance and Evolution:** Debugging, fault localization, refactoring, reengineering, reverse engineering, software reuse, API design and management.
4.  **Human and Social Aspects:** Software engineering processes (agile, DevOps), green and sustainable technologies, software engineering ethics, economics, code review, program comprehension, crowd-based/collaborative SE, human-computer interface.
5.  **AI and Software Engineering:** Autonomous/self-adapting systems, search-based SE, recommender systems, AI4SE, SE4AI.
6.  **Software Analytics:** Mining software repositories, mobile app analysis, data-driven UX, data-driven decision making, software metrics.
7.  **Formal Aspects of Software Engineering:** Formal methods, model checking, programming languages, domain-specific languages, software validation and verification.
8.  **Security and Other Non-Functional Properties:** Security, privacy, dependability, safety, reliability, availability, performance.
9.  **Performance:** (Covered under Security and Other Non-Functional Properties)

ASE also welcomes submissions across application domains like mobile, cloud, blockchains, cyber-physical systems, and ubiquitous systems.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Link:** [https://ase25.hotcrp.com/](https://ase25.hotcrp.com/)
*   **Template:** Conforms to IEEE Conference Proceedings Formatting Guidelines. Authors must use `\documentclass[10pt,conference]{IEEEtran}` in LaTeX.
*   **Page Limit:** **10 pages** (excluding references) + **2 pages** (references only) for initial submission. Accepted papers can have up to 11 pages (plus 2 for references).
*   **Categories:** Papers must be submitted as either **Technical Research Papers** or **Experience Papers**.
*   **Review Process:** ASE 2025 employs a **double-anonymous review process**. Authors must omit their names and affiliations and cite their prior work in the third person.
*   **Artifact Availability:** Authors are strongly encouraged to disclose anonymized and curated data for reproducibility and replicability.
*   **ACM Policy on Research Involving Humans:** Compliance must be affirmed for papers involving human subjects.

## Review Criteria

Submissions will be evaluated based on:

*   **Significance:** Impact on the field.
*   **Novelty:** Originality with respect to the state-of-the-art.
*   **Soundness:** Rigor of research methods.
*   **Importance and Scope (for Experience Papers):** Practical relevance and context.
*   **Insights and Evidence (for Experience Papers):** Clarity of conclusions and lessons learned.
*   **Perspective (for Experience Papers):** Value for other researchers/practitioners.
*   **Verifiability:** Information supporting reproducibility.
*   **Presentation:** Clarity, English quality, and adherence to formatting.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

## Contact Information

For questions, please contact the PC chairs at [ase25.conf@gmail.com](mailto:ase25.conf@gmail.com).

# Call for Papers: CANS 2025

## About the conference

The International Conference on Cryptology and Network Security (CANS) is a premier forum for presenting research in the field of cryptology and network security. The conference seeks academic, industry, and government submissions on all theoretical and practical aspects of cryptology and network security, and its extended domains in modern computing systems. This year marks the 24th iteration of the conference and will be held at **Osaka, Japan**. Proceedings of this year’s conference will be published by **Springer LNCS**.

## Submission Guidelines

*   High-quality papers on unpublished research and implementation experiences may be submitted.
*   All papers must be original and not substantially duplicated work that has been published at, or is simultaneously submitted to, a journal or another conference or workshop.
*   All submissions must be written in English and span no more than **20 pages** in Springer’s Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) format, including title, abstract, and bibliography.
*   The introduction should summarize the contributions of the paper at a level understandable by a non-expert reader and explain the context to related work.
*   Submitted papers may contain supplementary material in the form of well-marked appendices or a separate file archive (particularly for source code, data files, etc.). Note that supplementary material will not be included in the proceedings.
*   **Author names and affiliations should not appear in the paper.** The authors should make a reasonable effort not to reveal their identities or institutional affiliations in the text, figures, photos, links, or other data that is contained in the paper.
*   The conference will also consider **short papers of up to eight pages** in the LNCS format, excluding the bibliography (max 2 pages), for results that are not yet fully fleshed out or that simply require fewer pages to describe but still make a significant contribution.
*   All submissions must be processed with **LaTeX2e** according to the instructions given by Springer, using the plain Springer LNCS format.

## Submission Process

*   Papers must be submitted via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=cans2025](https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=cans2025)

## Important Dates

*   **Registration of new submissions permitted until:** [Changed or passed: April 17] **April 28 AoE**.
*   **Updates of existing submissions permitted until:** May 1st AoE.
*   **Notification:** July 10
*   **Camera-ready:** August 14
*   **Conference:** November 17–20

## Presentation Requirements

*   At least one author of every accepted paper must register and pay the full registration fee (non-student) for the conference by the early registration deadline indicated by the organizers.
*   Papers without a registered author will be removed from the sessions.
*   Authors must present their own paper(s).

## Stipend

The CANS 2025 conference will offer a student grant program to partially support travel and accommodation expenses for full-time students. Eligibility is limited to students whose papers have been accepted, who have paid the conference fee, and who will present their paper at the conference in CANS 2025.

## Best Paper Awards

The Program Committee will consider giving a Best Paper Award to the submission with highest merits.

## Topic Areas

1.  **Cryptographic Primitives and Protocols**
    *   Symmetric and asymmetric key cryptography
    *   Public key encryption
    *   Digital signatures
    *   Key exchange
    *   Hash functions
2.  **Cryptographic Foundations**
    *   Foundations of cryptography
    *   Secure multi-party computation
    *   Zero-knowledge proofs
    *   Post-quantum cryptography
    *   Lattice-based cryptography
3.  **Network and System Security**
    *   Network security
    *   Malware analysis
    *   Intrusion detection
    *   Secure routing and naming
    *   Wireless and mobile security
4.  **Privacy and Data Protection**
    *   Privacy-preserving data mining
    *   Differential privacy
    *   Anonymity and censorship resistance
    *   Privacy in machine learning
5.  **Applications and Emerging Technologies**
    *   Blockchain and cryptocurrencies
    *   Secure computation in the cloud
    *   IoT security
    *   AI and security

# CAADRIA 2025: Call for Papers - Architectural Informatics

The Association for Computer-Aided Architectural Design Research in Asia (CAADRIA) presents CAADRIA 2025, themed **"Architectural Informatics"**, from **March 22-29, 2025** in **Tokyo**.

## Conference Theme

CAADRIA 2025 invites contributions that reexamine the fundamental existence of architecture in the age of information technology, viewing architecture and cities as information systems. The conference encourages original, high-quality papers presenting current computer-aided architectural design research across various approaches.

## Topics of Interest

*   Artificial intelligence, neural networks and machine learning
*   Building Information Modeling (BIM)
*   City Information Modeling (CIM)
*   Collective, collaborative & interdisciplinary design
*   Computational design research & education
*   Design cognition and human-computer interaction
*   Disrupted practices, resilience, and social sustainability
*   Environmental and ecological performance
*   Generative, algorithmic & evolutionary design
*   Digital Heritage
*   Interactive environments
*   Material systems, processes and assembly
*   Practice-based design research
*   Robotics, digital fabrication and construction
*   Simulation, visualisation and impact projection
*   Theory, philosophy & methodology of computational design research
*   Urban analytics, big data analysis and smart cities
*   AR / VR / XR
*   Application of technology in the context of the Asia-Pacific Region

## Submission Process & Guidelines

*   **Submission Portal:** Access OpenConf at [https://caadria.org/openconf25/openconf.php](https://caadria.org/openconf25/openconf.php)
*   **Review Process:** A two-stage reviewing process, based on an initial abstract review and a later double-blind peer review of full-length manuscripts.
*   **Paper Template:** Adherence to the template is mandatory for publication. Download the template [here](https://www.caadria2025.org/_files/ugd/027792_636b230dacc24533a511a76894b8cf4b.docx?dn=CAADRIA2025_TEMPLATE.docx).
*   **Submission Format:** Papers must be uploaded as a single zip folder containing both the revised Word document and the PDF file.
*   **First Author Requirement:** Each paper must have a unique first author.
*   **Presentation Requirement:** CAADRIA 2025 is an **in-person-only event**. For each accepted paper, at least one author is required to register and present on-site.
*   **Registration:** Conference registration is open. Early-bird participants can enjoy reduced rates until **January 27, 2025**.

## Additional Participation Opportunities

*   **Project Exhibition (Posters):** Submit a poster to showcase your work. Submission deadline: **January 15, 2025**.
*   **Postgraduate Student Consortium (PGSC):** Master’s and PhD students can apply to present their research and receive feedback. Submission deadline: **January 15, 2025**.
*   **Young CAADRIA Award (YCA):** Open to all registered students (undergraduate and postgraduate) with an accepted paper. Awardees receive a waiver for their conference registration fee.
*   **Workshops:** Applications are open until **January 20, 2025**. Seats are limited and allocated on a first-come, first-served basis.

# CADE-30: Call for Papers

The 30th International Conference on Automated Deduction (CADE-30) will be held at **DHBW Stuttgart, Germany**, from **July 28th to August 2nd, 2025**. The main conference runs from July 28th to July 31st, with satellite events on August 1st and 2nd.

CADE is the major international forum for presenting research on all aspects of automated deduction. High-quality submissions on the general topic of automated deduction, including logical foundations, theory and principles, applications in and beyond computer science and mathematics, and implementations of automated reasoning systems are solicited. CADE-30 aims to present research that reflects the broad range of interesting and relevant topics in automated deduction.

## Publication

CADE-30 proceedings will be published in **Springer's Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence series** in Gold Open Access mode at a special rate of **EUR 200 per paper**. Authors of accepted papers who cannot cover the fee can apply for funding.

## Submission Instructions

Submissions can be made in two categories:

*   **Regular papers:** Up to **15 pages** in LNCS style, excluding references. Proofs of theoretical results that do not fit in the page limit may be provided in an appendix.
*   **Short papers:** Includes system descriptions, user experiences, case studies, and domain models. Up to **10 pages** in LNCS style, excluding references.

Submissions must be unpublished and not submitted for publication elsewhere. They will be judged on relevance, significance, originality, correctness, and readability. Reviewers may consider material provided in appendices, but submissions must be self-contained within the page limit.

If software or data is relevant to a paper, a link that provides access to the software/data must be provided to enable reproduction of results.

The review process will include a feedback/rebuttal period, where authors will have the option to respond to reviewer comments.

Selected accepted papers will be considered by the Program Committee for the **CADE Best Paper Award** or **Best Student Paper Award** (provided that at least one author is a student).

All submissions must be formatted in the **LNCS style** and must include the ORCID id of at least the corresponding author, and preferably of all authors.

## Submission Portal

Submissions must be made via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cade30](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cade30) in the Main Conference track.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract deadline:** February 17, 2025
*   **Submission deadline:** February 24, 2025

*   **Notification:** April 28, 2025
*   **Final version deadline:** May 30, 2025
*   **Main conference:** July 28-31, 2025
*   **Satellite events:** August 1-2, 2025

## Program Committee Chairs

*   Clark Barrett, Stanford University
*   Uwe Waldmann, Max Planck Institute for Informatics

# BPM 2025: Call for Research Papers

The International Conference on Business Process Management (BPM) is the premier forum for researchers and practitioners in the field of BPM. BPM 2025 invites submissions that embrace the interdisciplinary nature of BPM, seeking contributions from computer science, information systems engineering, and information systems management.

The conference is structured into three tracks:

*   **Track I: Foundations:** Focuses on formal, mathematical, algorithmic, or conceptual aspects of BPM, including principles, computational theories, formal methods, algorithms for modeling, automating, analyzing, and optimizing business processes, as well as conceptual papers on frameworks, taxonomies, and patterns.
*   **Track II: Engineering:** Focuses on the development and investigation of artifacts and systems that solve concrete problems in business environments. This includes tools and techniques for process modeling, enactment, monitoring, and analytics (process mining), with rigorous and reproducible empirical evaluations.
*   **Track III: Management:** Focuses on the empirical, socio-technical, cognitive, psychological, managerial, and societal aspects of BPM. It examines how process management concepts and information systems deliver business value, including strategic alignment, governance, methods, technology, people, and culture.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Each paper must be submitted to exactly one track. Authors are advised to consult track descriptions to select the most appropriate track.
*   Papers must be formatted according to **Springer’s LNCS formatting guidelines**.
*   Submissions must be in **English** and cannot exceed **16 pages**, including references and appendices.
*   The title page must contain a short abstract clarifying the relation of the paper with the topics.
*   The paper must state the problem being addressed, the goal of the work, the results achieved, and the relation to other work.
*   Submissions must be original contributions that have neither been published previously nor submitted to other conferences or journals while being submitted to BPM 2025.
*   Submissions must be in **PDF format** via the [BPM 2025 EasyChair submission site](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=bpm2025).

## Review Process

BPM 2025 employs a **double-blind review process**. Authors must anonymize their submissions, including removing author names, affiliations, and acknowledgments from the first page. Supplementary materials and code should also be anonymized. Papers that include identifying information may be rejected.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings published by **Springer in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series**. Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version to a special issue of the journal **Process Science**.

## Awards

The conference will recognize outstanding contributions with a **Best Paper Award** and a **Best Student Paper Award**. Student papers must be clearly marked during submission and presented by a student author to be eligible.

## BPM Forum

Papers that do not fully meet the quality criteria for the main conference but make a significant contribution to the community will be invited for presentation at the BPM Forum and published in a separate post-proceedings volume in the **Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing (LNBIP) series**.

## Key Dates (Research Papers)

*   **Paper Abstract submission:** March 4, 2025
*   **Paper submission:** March 18, 2025
*   **Notification to authors:** May 8, 2025
*   **Camera-ready submission:** June 13, 2025

*Deadlines correspond to Anywhere on Earth (AoE or UTC-12).* 

**Note:** Deadlines differ for other calls such as Workshops, Industry & Society Forum, Educators Forum, etc.

The workshop is dedicated to fostering discussions between academia and industry on new developments in the field of Automatic Speech Recognition and Understanding.

## About the Workshop

ASRU focuses on areas including, but not limited to, speech recognition systems, spoken dialog systems, speech analysis, paralinguistics phenomena in speech, applications of automatic speech recognition and speech analysis, large language models for speech, and speech foundation models.

## Calls for Submission

ASRU 2025 invites contributions through the following calls:

*   **Call for Papers:** For original research contributions.
*   **Call for Tutorials:** Proposals for tutorials on relevant topics.
*   **Call for Special Sessions:** Proposals for focused sessions on emerging topics.
*   **Call for Challenges:** Participation in or proposals for speech recognition and understanding challenges.
*   **Call for Demo, System and Data Papers:** Submissions showcasing demos, systems, or new datasets.

More detailed information can be found on the respective pages linked from the main website.

## Topics of Interest

The technical areas covered by ASRU 2025 include:

*   Towards the New Era of Spoken Language Understanding System Utilizing LLMs
*   Speech Understanding
*   Automatic Speech Recognition
*   Spoken Language Processing
*   Speech Enhancement and Separation
*   Speech Analysis

# APSEC 2025: Call for Papers - Technical Track

The 32nd Asia-Pacific Software Engineering Conference (APSEC 2025) will be held on **December 2-5, 2025, in Macao SAR, China**, at the **Wynn Palace**.

APSEC has long been established as a leading regional conference that gathers researchers and practitioners from academia, industry, and government to exchange knowledge and best practices in software engineering and to address emerging challenges and solutions in software engineering innovation.

## Topics of Interest (Technical Track)

The APSEC 2025 technical research track invites high-quality contributions describing original results in the discipline of software engineering. Solicited topics include, but are not limited to:

### Tools and Processes
*   Agile processes
*   DevOps and Container
*   Configuration Management and Deployment
*   Software Engineering Process and Standards

### Requirements and Design
*   Service-oriented Computing
*   Component-based Software Engineering
*   Cooperative, Distributed, and Global Software Engineering
*   Software Architecture, Modeling and Design
*   Middleware, Frameworks, and APIs
*   Software Product-line Engineering

### Testing and Analysis
*   Testing, Verification, and Validation
*   Program Analysis
*   Program Synthesis
*   Program Repairs

### Formal Aspects of Software Engineering
*   Formal Methods
*   Model-driven and Domain-specific Engineering

### Human Factors and Social Aspects of Software Engineering
*   Software Comprehension, Visualization, and Traceability
*   Software for Green and Sustainable Technologies

### AI and Software Engineering
*   AI for Software Engineering
*   Software Engineering for AI
*   Search-based Software Engineering

### Dependability, Safety, and Reliability
*   Reliability, availability, and safety
*   Performance
*   Vulnerability detection to enhance software security

### Software Maintenance and Evolution
*   Refactoring
*   Reverse Engineering
*   Software Reuse
*   Software Project Management
*   Debugging, Defect Prediction, and Fault Localization

### Software Repository Mining and Data Analytics

APSEC 2025 welcomes submissions addressing topics in a variety of application domains, including mobile, cloud, blockchains, embedded, and cyber-physical systems.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Page Limit:** Technical research papers must not exceed **12 pages** (including references).
*   **Review Process:** Submissions will be evaluated by at least three program committee members. The evaluation will focus on novelty, originality, importance to the field, proper use of research methods, and presentation.
*   **Previous Publication:** Submitted papers must have been neither previously accepted for publication nor concurrently submitted for review in another journal, book, conference, or workshop.
*   **Format:** All submissions must be in English and must come in A4 paper size **PDF format** and conform to the **IEEE Conference Proceedings Formatting Guidelines**. Authors must use `\documentclass[10pt,conference]{IEEEtran}` without including the `compsoc` or `compsocconf` option.
*   **Double-Blind Policy:** APSEC 2025 will use a double-blind reviewing process. Authors must omit authors' names and institutions from the title page. References to authors' own related work must be in the third person. Avoid including acknowledgements that would reveal identity. For detailed instructions, please refer to the [APSEC 2025 double-blind instructions](https://conf.researchr.org/track/apsec-2025/apsec-2025-papers).
*   **Open Science:** Authors are encouraged to consider disclosing source code and datasets, ideally using services like zenodo.org or figshare.com to avoid revealing identity.

## Submission Link

Papers must be submitted through HotCRP: [https://apsec25.hotcrp.com](https://apsec25.hotcrp.com)

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Abstract Deadline (Optional):** July 13, 2025
*   **Paper Deadline:** July 20, 2025
*   **Author Notification:** September 20, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** October 20, 2025

## Accepted Papers

All accepted papers will be included in the IEEE Digital Library as the APSEC 2025 conference proceedings. No additional page content is permitted. Authors must reflect reviewers' comments in the camera-ready version. The list of authors and paper titles cannot be changed after acceptance without permission.

## Conference Attendance Expectation

At least one author of an accepted paper must register for APSEC 2025 and present the paper at the conference. Papers not presented will be removed from the proceedings.

# Call for Papers: CAV 2025

CAV 2025 is the 37th International Conference on Computer Aided Verification, taking place in **Zagreb, Croatia**, from **July 21-25, 2025**.

## Scope

CAV 2025 is dedicated to the advancement of the theory and practice of computer-aided formal analysis methods for hardware and software systems. The conference emphasizes practical verification tools, and the algorithms and techniques needed for their implementation. It aims to spur advances in hardware and software verification and expand into new domains such as machine learning, autonomous systems, and computer security.

The proceedings of the conference will be published in the **Springer-Verlag Lecture Notes in Computer Science series**. A selection of papers will be invited to a special issue of Formal Methods in System Design and the Journal of the ACM.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Algorithms and tools for verifying models and implementations
*   Algorithms and tools for system synthesis
*   Algorithms and tools that combine verification and learning
*   Mathematical and logical foundations of verification and synthesis
*   Specifications and correctness criteria for programs and systems
*   Deductive verification using proof assistants
*   Hardware verification techniques
*   Program analysis and software verification
*   Software synthesis
*   Hybrid systems and embedded systems verification
*   Formal methods for cyber-physical systems
*   Compositional and abstraction-based techniques for verification
*   Probabilistic and statistical approaches to verification
*   Verification methods for parallel and concurrent systems
*   Testing and run-time analysis based on verification technology
*   Decision procedures and solvers for verification and synthesis
*   Applications and case studies in verification and synthesis
*   Verification in industrial practice
*   New application areas for algorithmic verification and synthesis
*   Formal models and methods for security
*   Formal models and methods for biological systems
*   AI safety and explainability using formal methods

Submissions on a wide range of topics are sought, particularly those identifying new research directions.

## Submission Categories

*   **Regular Papers:** (18 pages max, must be anonymized)
*   **Tool Papers:** (10 pages max, not anonymized)
*   **Industrial Experience Reports & Case Studies:** (10 pages max, not anonymized)

## Important Dates (All AoE - Anywhere on Earth)

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** January 31, 2025 (*Firm*)
*   **Author Response Period:** March 11 - 14, 2025
*   **Author Notification:** April 2, 2025
*   **Early Registration Deadline:** June 22, 2025
*   **Workshops:** July 21-22, 2025
*   **Main Conference:** July 23-25, 2025

## Submission Site

*   Main submission site: [https://cav2025.hotcrp.com/](https://cav2025.hotcrp.com/)

## Paper Submission Guidelines

*   Papers must be submitted in LNCS format.
*   Simultaneous submission to other conferences with proceedings or submission of material already published elsewhere is not allowed.
*   The review process will include a feedback/rebuttal period.

### Regular Papers

*   Maximum 18 pages (excluding references and appendices).
*   **Full double-blind review process:** Author names and affiliations must be omitted. Prior work by authors should be referenced in the third person.
*   Authors are encouraged to consult SIGPLAN’s Empirical Evaluation Guidelines when reporting on empirical results.
*   Authors may include a clearly marked appendix (exempt from page limits), but reviewers are not obliged to read it.

### Tool Papers

*   Maximum 10 pages (excluding references and appendices).
*   **Single blind review process:** papers do NOT need to be anonymized.
*   Should describe system and implementation aspects of a tool with a large (potential) user base.
*   Authors must submit an artifact for evaluation; final acceptance is conditional on successful artifact evaluation at the “functional” level.

### Industrial Experience Reports and Case Studies

*   Maximum 10 pages (excluding references and appendices).
*   **Single blind review process:** papers do NOT need to be anonymized.
*   Expected to describe the use of formal methods techniques in industrial settings or new application domains.
*   Encouraged to discuss unique challenges of transferring research ideas to real-world settings.

## CAV Award

*   **Nomination Deadline:** March 1, 2025
*   Nominations should include a proposed citation, a description of the contribution, and justification.
*   Cited contributions must have been made between 5 and 25 years ago and not yet received major awards.
*   For details and submission, please see: [https://conferences.i-cav.org/2025/award/](https://conferences.i-cav.org/2025/award/)

## Contact

The 14th EAI International Conference on Arts, Interactivity & Game Creation (ArtsIT 2025) will be held from **7-9 November, 2025**, at **Heriot-Watt University Dubai, UAE**. This is a **Hybrid Conference**.

# CASES 2025: Call for Papers

# CC 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM SIGPLAN 2025 International Conference on Compiler Construction (CC 2025) is interested in work on processing programs in the most general sense: analyzing, transforming, or executing input programs that describe how a system operates, including traditional compiler construction as a special case.

Original contributions are solicited on the topics of interest, which include, but are not limited to:

*   **Compilation and interpretation techniques**: including program representation, analysis, and transformation; code generation, optimization, and synthesis; the verification thereof.
*   **Run-time techniques**: including memory management, virtual machines, and dynamic and just-in-time compilation.
*   **Programming tools**: including refactoring editors, checkers, verifiers, compilers, debuggers, and profilers.
*   **Techniques**: ranging from programming languages to micro-architectural support, for specific domains such as secure, parallel, distributed, embedded, or mobile environments.
*   **Design and implementation of novel language constructs**, programming models, and domain-specific languages.
*   **Implications to compiler construction** from emerging or non-conventional applications (e.g., deep learning, quantum computing, DNA computing, etc.).

CC is an ACM SIGPLAN conference and implements guidelines and procedures recommended by SIGPLAN. Prospective authors should be aware of ACM’s Copyright policies. Proceedings will be made available online in the ACM digital library from one week before to one week after the conference.

## Call for Tool and Practical Experience Papers

This year, CC will offer a second category of papers called “Tools and Practical Experience”. Papers in this category must either give a clear account of a tool’s functionality or summarize a practical experience with realistic case studies. The successful evaluation of an artifact is mandatory for a Tool Paper. The selection criteria include originality, usability, documentation, benchmark repository, availability, foundations, and artifact evaluation.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission site:** [https://cc25.hotcrp.com](https://cc25.hotcrp.com)
*   All submissions must be made electronically and include an abstract (100–400 words), author contact information, and the full list of authors and their affiliations.
*   **Format:** Papers must be in PDF, prepared in ACM Conference Format using the 2-column acmart format (use `\documentclass[sigplan,10pt,review,anonymous]{acmart}` for Latex, and `interim-layout.docx` for Word). Ensure the Word template uses 10pt font.
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum of 10 pages of text (in a typeface no smaller than 10 point) or figures, NOT INCLUDING references. References must include the name of all authors.
*   **Appendices:** Not allowed, but authors may submit anonymous supplementary material (PDF or ZIP).
*   **Review Process:** CC uses a double-blind reviewing process. Submissions must not reveal the identity of the authors. References to authors’ own related work should be in the third person.

# ATVA 2025: Call for Papers

ATVA 2025 is the 23rd edition of the International Symposium on Automated Technology for Verification and Analysis, dedicated to promoting research on theoretical and practical aspects of automated analysis, synthesis, and verification of hardware and software systems. The conference will take place from **October 27-31, 2025**, in **Bengaluru, India**, at the **International Institute of Information Technology, Bangalore**.

## Tracks

*   **Research and Tool Papers**: Focuses on original research contributions and practical tools in automated verification and analysis.
*   **Artifacts**: Dedicated to the evaluation of research artifacts, ensuring reproducibility and rigor.
*   **Workshops**: Provides a forum for specialized discussions and focused research on emerging topics.
*   **Tutorials**: Offers educational sessions on key areas within automated verification and analysis.

## Topics of Interest

ATVA solicits high-quality submissions in the following areas:

*   Formalisms for modeling hardware, software, and embedded systems
*   Specification and verification of finite-state, infinite-state, and parameterized systems
*   Program analysis and software verification
*   Analysis and verification of hardware circuits, systems-on-chip, and embedded systems
*   Analysis of real-time, hybrid, priced, weighted, and probabilistic systems
*   Deductive, algorithmic, compositional, and abstraction/refinement techniques for analysis and verification
*   Analytical techniques for safety, security, and dependability
*   Testing and runtime analysis based on verification technology
*   Analysis and verification of parallel and concurrent systems
*   Verification in industrial practice
*   Synthesis for hardware and software systems
*   Applications and case studies of verification
*   Automated tool support for verification
*   Testing and verification of neural networks
*   Testing and verification of autonomous systems

## Submissions

ATVA welcomes submissions in two categories:

*   **Regular research papers**: Up to **18 pages** (excluding references and appendices). These papers must follow a **full double-blind review process**. Author names and affiliations must be omitted, and prior work by the authors must be referenced in the third person. Submissions should be formatted using **Springer’s LNCS format**. Adding line numbers (LaTeX package `lineno`) is highly recommended.
*   **Tool papers**: Up to **10 pages** (excluding references). These papers follow a **single-blind review process** and do **not** need to be anonymized. Tool paper submissions require a separate artifact submission. Papers describing tools with significant and clear enhancements compared to previous presentations will be accepted.

**Artifact Evaluation**: An artifact evaluation will be conducted. It is **optional for regular papers** and **mandatory for tool papers**.

**Submission Platform**: All papers must be submitted through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=atva2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=atva2025)

**Publication**: Accepted papers in both categories will be published in **Springer’s Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series. A few outstanding papers will be selected for a distinguished paper award.

# Call for Papers: ICIAP 2025

The **23rd International Conference on Computer Analysis of Images and Patterns (ICIAP 2025)** is organized biennially by CVPL, the Italian Member Society of the International Association for Pattern Recognition (IAPR).

The conference will take place in **Rome, Italy**, from **September 15-19, 2025**. The Workshops and Tutorials will be held on September 15-16, 2025, and the Main Conference from September 17-19, 2025.

ICIAP 2025 focuses on both traditional and emerging trends in computer vision, pattern recognition, and image processing, addressing both theoretical and practical aspects. The conference aims to serve as a stimulating discussion forum for researchers to meet, present their work, and exchange ideas, including oral and poster sessions, and offering invited keynote talks by distinguished speakers. The conference will also include satellite workshops and tutorials.

## Topics of Interest

The conference covers the following topics, with particular emphasis on:

*   Video Analysis and Understanding
*   Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
*   Deep Learning
*   Multiview Geometry and 3D Computer Vision
*   Image Analysis, Detection, and Recognition
*   Multimedia
*   Biomedical and Assistive Technology
*   Digital Forensics and Biometrics
*   Image Processing for Cultural Heritage
*   Robot and Vision
*   Brave New Ideas

## Submission Instructions

All submissions will be handled electronically via the conference’s CMT Website: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025)

*   **Templates and Instructions:** Authors can download the template and instructions from the provided link or use the [Overleaf Template](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025).

## Additional Author Guidelines

*   **Double-blind review:** ICIAP25 reviewing is double blind. Authors must not provide information that may identify them in the acknowledgments or any other part of the paper. Violation of these guidelines may lead to rejection without review.

# Call for Papers: IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE 2025)

The **2025 IEEE 21st International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE 2025)** is the flagship automation conference of the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society (RAS) and constitutes the primary forum for cross-industry and multidisciplinary research in automation.

**Conference Dates:** August 17 – August 21, 2025
**Location:** Los Angeles, California, USA
**Venue:** Millennium Biltmore Downtown Los Angeles, California, USA

## About CASE 2025

The conference will focus on **Secured and Trustworthy Automation**, exploring advancements in areas like collaborative robotics, self-operating systems, smart manufacturing, healthcare, farming, transportation, and smart cities. Research is sought to address vulnerabilities and biases in automation systems.

## Topics of Interest

The conference covers a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:

*   Foundation of Automation
*   Human-centered automation
*   Automation in life science and healthcare
*   Sustainability and green automation
*   Automation in agriculture and horticulture
*   Automation in meso, micro and nano-scale
*   Smart building and construction
*   Knowledge-based automation
*   Manufacturing automation
*   Cloud-based automation
*   Big data, data mining and machine learning
*   Privacy and security in automation

## Submission Categories

### Regular Papers
*   **Page Limit:** Up to 6 pages (including text, figures, tables, acknowledgements, and references). Two additional pages are permitted at an extra charge. Papers exceeding 8 pages will be returned without review.

# CIKM 2025: Call for Full Research Papers

The ACM International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management (CIKM) 2025 provides a unique venue for industry and academia to present and discuss state-of-the-art research on artificial intelligence, search and discovery, data mining, and database systems. CIKM 2025 will take place between **November 10-14, 2025** in **Coex, Seoul, Korea**.

## Key Dates

All deadlines are at 11:59pm in the Anywhere on Earth (AoE) time zone.

*   **Full Research Papers Abstract Deadline:** May 16, 2025
*   **Full Research Papers Submission Deadline:** May 23, 2025
*   **Short Research Papers Abstract Deadline:** May 30, 2025
*   **Short Research Papers Submission Deadline:** June 6, 2025
*   **Resource Papers Abstract Deadline:** June 10, 2025
*   **Demo Papers Abstract Deadline:** June 10, 2025
*   **Resource Papers Submission Deadline:** June 17, 2025
*   **Demo Papers Submission Deadline:** June 17, 2025
*   **Notifications (for Full, Short, Applied, Resource, and Demo Papers):** August 4, 2025
*   **Tutorials Proposal Submission:** June 14, 2025
*   **Workshops Proposal Submission:** June 28, 2025
*   **Tutorials Proposal Notification:** July 8, 2025
*   **Workshops Proposal Notification:** July 19, 2025

## Topics of Interest

We encourage submissions of high-quality research papers on the general areas of artificial intelligence, data science, databases, information retrieval, and knowledge management. Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Data acquisition and processing (e.g., IoT Data, Data Quality, Data Privacy, Mitigating Biases, Data Wrangling, Data exploration, Data Preparation, Valuation, and Trading)
*   Data Integration and aggregation (e.g., Semantic Processing, data provenance, data linkage, data fusion, knowledge graph, data warehousing, data lake, privacy and security, modeling, information credibility)
*   Efficient data processing (e.g., serverless, data-intensive computing, database systems, indexing and compression, architectures, distributed data systems, dataspaces, customized hardware)
*   Special data processing (e.g., multilingual text, sequential, stream, time series, spatio-temporal, (knowledge) graph, multimedia, scientific, and social media data)
*   Analytics and machine learning (e.g., OLAP, data mining, machine learning and AI, scalable analysis algorithms, algorithmic biases, event detection and tracking, algorithmic interpretability)
*   Neural Information and knowledge processing (e.g., graph neural networks, domain adaptation, transfer learning, network architectures, neural ranking, neural recommendation, and neural prediction)
*   Information access and retrieval (e.g., Information Retrieval with Large Language Models, Question Answering and Dialogue Systems, Open-ended Question Answering Systems, Generation of Knowledge Graphs from Unstructured data, Retrieval Models, Query Processing, Personalization, Recommender Systems, Filtering Systems)
*   Users and interfaces for information systems (e.g., user behavior analysis, user interface design, perception of biases, interactive information retrieval, interactive analysis, spoken interfaces)
*   Evaluation (e.g., performance studies, benchmarks, online and offline evaluation, best practices)
*   Crowdsourcing (e.g. task assignment, worker reliability, optimization, trustworthiness, transparency, crowdsourcing in the era of large language models)
*   Mining multi-modal content (e.g., natural language processing, speech recognition, computer vision, content understanding, knowledge extraction, knowledge representations)
*   Data presentation (e.g., visualization, summarization, readability, VR, speech input/output)
*   Fairness, Ethics, and Explainability in Information and Knowledge Management (e.g., fairness, accountability, ethics, explainability)
*   Applications (e.g., urban systems, biomedical and health informatics, legal informatics, crisis informatics, computational social science, data-enabled discovery, social networks, education, business)
*   Generative AI for Data and Knowledge Management (e.g., GenAI for structured and unstructured data processing, GenAI for data synthesis and simulation, GenAI for information summarization, content creation, and visualization)
*   Resource Efficient Generative AI models for knowledge management (e.g., model compression, distributed learning, and leveraging edge computing to reduce computational overhead.)

## Paper Submissions

*   Authors are invited to submit original, full-length research papers that are not previously published, accepted to be published, or being considered for publication in any other forum.
*   Full-length papers should satisfy the standard requirements of top-tier international research conferences.
*   Manuscripts should be submitted to CIKM 2025 Easychair site in PDF format, using the **2-column ACM sigconf template**.
*   **Full papers:** Cannot exceed 9 pages, including an appendix, plus unlimited pages for the GenAI Usage Disclosure section and references (paper content is limited to 9 pages).
*   Rejected full papers will not be considered for publication as short papers.
*   The review of manuscripts will be **double-blind**, and submissions not properly anonymized will be desk-rejected without review.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper must register to present the work on-site in Seoul, Korea.

## Usage of Generative AI

*   Technical papers submitted to CIKM are required to include a **“GenAI Usage Disclosure” section** at the end of the limited pages of main contents and appendix, right before the references.
*   Authors must provide full disclosure of all use of GenAI tools in all stages of the research (including code and data).
*   This section, together with references, will not be counted toward the page limit.
*   AI tools may be used to edit and polish authors’ work (e.g., grammar checks, word autocorrect), but text “produced entirely” by generative/AI models is not allowed.

All submissions must comply with the ACM policy on the usage of GenAI: [https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/frequently-asked-questions#h-can-i-use-generative-ai-software-tools-to-prepare-my-manuscript](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/frequently-asked-questions#h-can-i-use-generative-ai-software-tools-to-prepare-my-manuscript)

## Dual Submission Policy

Submitting identical or substantially similar papers to other forums is not allowed. Abstract submissions are permitted for papers still under review, provided the review process concludes by the full paper deadline. Submissions must be withdrawn if accepted elsewhere or still under review by the deadline.

Anonymized work available as a preprint (e.g., on arXiv) is allowed, but requires modifying the title and abstract, and refraining from citing the preprint to maintain anonymity.

## Authorship Policy

*   Authorship names, including ordering, must be finalized by the paper submission deadline. No changes are permitted after this deadline.
*   Authors are advised to review the [ACM’s authorship policy](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/new-acm-policy-on-authorship) carefully.

## ACM Conflict of Interest Policy

All authors must adhere to the ACM Conflict of Interest policy: [https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/conflict-of-interest](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/conflict-of-interest)

## Desk Rejection Policy

Submissions failing to adhere to anonymity, length, or formatting requirements, or violating ACM’s policies on academic dishonesty (plagiarism, author misrepresentation, falsification), may be subject to desk rejection.

## ACM Policy Against Harassment

All authors and participants must adhere to the ACM Policy Against Harassment: [https://www.acm.org/about-acm/policy-against-harassment](https://www.acm.org/about-acm/policy-against-harassment)

*   Senjuti Basu Roy, New Jersey Institute of Technology, USA

*   Jaap Kamps, University of Amsterdam, Netherlands

For more information, contact the PC chairs at [cikm2025-pc@easychair.org](mailto:cikm2025-pc@easychair.org)

# Call for Papers: COLING 2025

The 31st International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING 2025) invites submissions of long and short papers featuring substantial, original, and unpublished research in all aspects of Computational Linguistics and Natural Language Processing.

**Conference Dates:** January 19 – 24, 2025 (Main Conference, In-Person Only) and January 27 – 28, 2025 (Virtual Presentation Sessions).

**Location:** Abu Dhabi, UAE.

## Topics of Interest

Relevant topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Dialogue and Interactive Systems
*   Discourse and Pragmatics
*   Document Classification and Topic Modeling
*   Ethics, Bias, and Fairness
*   Information Extraction
*   Information Retrieval and Text Mining
*   Interpretability and Analysis of Models for NLP
*   Language Modeling
*   Language Resources and Evaluation
*   Linguistic Insights Derived using Computational Techniques
*   Linguistic Theories, Cognitive Modeling and Psycholinguistics
*   Low-Resource and Efficient Methods for NLP
*   Machine Learning for Computational Linguistics and NLP
*   Machine Translation and Translation Aids
*   Multilingualism and Language Diversity
*   Multimodal and Grounded Language Acquisition
*   NLP and LLM Applications (such as Education, Healthcare, Finance, Legal NLP, Computational Social Science, etc.)
*   Natural Language Generation
*   Offensive Speech Detection and Analysis
*   Phonology, Morphology and Word Segmentation
*   Question Answering
*   Lexical Semantics
*   Sentence-level Semantics (Textual Inference, Paraphrasing, etc)
*   Sentiment Analysis, Stylistic Analysis, Opinion and Argument Mining
*   Speech Recognition and Synthesis, and Spoken Language Understanding
*   Summarization and Simplification
*   Syntactic analysis (Tagging, Chunking, Parsing)
*   Vision and Robotics

Papers targeting any of these topics from the perspective of the Sustainability Goals of the UN are especially welcome.

## Submission Details

COLING 2025 invites the submission of:

*   **Long papers:** up to **eight pages** for the main body.
*   **Short papers:** up to **four pages** for the main body.

These page limits apply only to the main body of the paper. Papers must include a mandatory section discussing the limitations of the work and, optionally, a section discussing ethical considerations. Papers can include unlimited pages of references and an unlimited appendix.

Authors must follow the [general instructions for COLING 2025 proceedings](https://coling2025.org/downloads/coling-2025.pdf), which are an adaptation of the general instructions for *ACL proceedings.

**Style Files:**

*   [LaTeX](https://coling2025.org/downloads/coling-2025.zip)
*   [Word](https://coling2025.org/downloads/coling-2025.docx)
*   [Overleaf](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/instructions-for-coling-2025-proceedings/hfhcytgpqmzf)

Papers deviating from the provided style files will be rejected without review.

COLING 2025 adopts the [ACL Ethics Policy](https://www.aclweb.org/portal/about/ethics).

## Submission Routes

1.  **Direct Submission:**
    *   Submit through Softconf/START using the link: [https://softconf.com/coling2025/papers/](https://softconf.com/coling2025/papers/)
    *   Each paper will receive a minimum of three reviews.
    *   Authors will have the opportunity to provide a short rebuttal.
    *   The review process will be **double-blind**.

2.  **ACL Rolling Review (ARR) Papers:**
    *   Papers reviewed through the ARR system can be committed to COLING 2025.
    *   These papers will not be re-reviewed. Decisions will be based on ARR reviews and meta-reviews.
    *   Commit ARR papers using [Softconf/START](https://softconf.com/coling2025/papers/).

For additional information, please see the [FAQ for submissions](https://coling2025.org/faqs/submission/).

## Optional Supplementary Materials: Appendices, Software and Data

Each submission can be accompanied by a single .tgz or .zip archive containing supplementary materials (e.g., program code, datasets). COLING 2025 encourages the submission of such materials to improve reproducibility. For the main track, supplementary materials must be fully anonymized.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are 11:59 PM UTC-12:00 (“anywhere on Earth”).

*   **Direct Submission Deadline:** September 16, 2024
*   **ARR Commitment Deadline:** October 20, 2024
*   **Author Rebuttal Phase (Direct Submissions):** October 30 - November 1, 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** November 29, 2024
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** December 15, 2024
*   **Arabic NLP Winter School:** January 18 - 19, 2025
*   **Workshops and Tutorials:** January 19 - 20, 2025
*   **Main Conference (In-Person):** January 21 - 24, 2025
*   **Main Conference (Virtual):** January 27 - 28, 2025

## Anonymity Policy

COLING 2025 follows the ACL Anonymity Policy. Submissions must be fully anonymized. Authors are cautioned against extensive advertising.

## Multiple Submission Policy

Papers submitted to COLING 2025 cannot be under review for other conferences or journals simultaneously. Committing a paper through ARR is treated as being under review. Papers committed to COLING 2025 via ARR cannot be submitted directly. Submissions that significantly overlap in content or results with published work will be desk-rejected.

## Contact Information

For questions about submissions, please contact: [coling2025-programchairs@googlegroups.com](mailto:coling2025-programchairs@googlegroups.com)

# CIAC 2025: Call for Papers

The 14th International Conference on Algorithms and Complexity (CIAC 2025) is scheduled to take place from **June 10 to June 12, 2025**, at **LUISS University in Rome, Italy**.

## Aims and Scope

The conference aims to provide a forum for researchers working in all aspects of computational complexity and the use, design, analysis, and experimentation of efficient algorithms and data structures.

## Topics of Interest

Authors are invited to submit papers presenting original and unpublished research on algorithms and complexity. Typical areas include:

*   Algorithm design and analysis
*   Sequential, parallel, and distributed algorithms
*   Data structures
*   Computational and structural complexity
*   Lower bounds and limitations of algorithms
*   Randomized and approximation algorithms
*   Parameterized algorithms and parameterized complexity classes
*   Smoothed analysis of algorithms
*   Alternatives to the worst-case analysis of algorithms (e.g., algorithms with predictions)
*   On-line computation and competitive analysis
*   Streaming algorithms
*   Quantum algorithms and complexity
*   Algorithms in algebra, geometry, number theory and combinatorics
*   Computational geometry
*   Algorithmic game theory and mechanism design
*   Algorithmic economics (including auctions and contests)
*   Computational learning theory
*   Computational biology and bioinformatics
*   Algorithmic issues in communication networks
*   Algorithms for discrete optimization (including convex optimization)
*   Algorithm engineering

## Important Dates

*   **Deadline for submissions:** November 22, 2024 (AoE) *(extended from November 15, 2024)*
*   **Author notification:** January 31, 2025
*   **Camera-ready due:** February 14, 2025
*   **Author Registration:** April 03, 2025
*   **Early Registration:** May 03, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Site:** Submissions should be made through EasyChair at [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ciac2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ciac2025).
*   **Format:** The usage of the **LNCS style file is mandatory**. LNCS templates are available [here](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines). No changes to font size, page geometry, etc. are permitted.
*   **Length:** Papers should have at most 15 pages, excluding the title page and the references. The title page consists of the title of the paper and the abstract. The first section of the paper should start on the next page.
*   **Content:** The paper should contain a succinct statement of the issues and their motivation, a summary of the results, a brief explanation of their significance, and a comparison to related work, accessible to non-specialists. Proofs omitted due to space constraints must be put into an appendix, to be read by the PC members at their discretion.
*   **Anonymity:** Submissions should be **anonymized** according to the double-blind review policy. Authors' names, affiliations, and email addresses should not appear at the beginning or in the body of the submission. Authors are free to disseminate their ideas or draft versions of their paper as they normally would (e.g., on their webpage or through pre-print dissemination websites such as arXiv).
*   **Conflicts of Interest:** When submitting a paper, please indicate Conflict of Interest (CoI) with PC members.
*   **Simultaneous Submissions:** Simultaneous submission to other conferences with published proceedings or to journals is **not allowed**.
*   **Late Submissions/Incorrect Format:** Late submissions and submissions not in the correct format will not be considered.
*   **Presentation Requirement:** At least one author of each accepted paper will have to register for the conference. For authors who cannot present their paper in person for a significant reason, the possibility of remote presentation may be offered.

## Double-Blind Reviewing

CIAC 2025 will implement a **lightweight double-blind reviewing process**. The purpose is to help PC members and external reviewers come to an initial judgment about the paper without bias, not to make it impossible for them to discover the authors if they were to try.

## Proceedings

Accepted papers will be published in the proceedings of the symposium as a volume in **Springer LNCS**.

## Best Paper Award

Two selected papers will receive the **Best Paper Award**, sponsored by Springer.

## Contact Information

All questions about submissions should be emailed to Loukas Georgiadis at [loukas@uoi.gr](mailto:loukas@uoi.gr).

# IEEE Cluster 2025: Call for Papers

IEEE Cluster 2025, the 27th edition of the IEEE Cluster conference series, will be held from **September 2-5, 2025**, in **Edinburgh, United Kingdom**. The conference is held in cooperation with SIGHPC.

Computing clusters are essential for high-performance computing, cloud computing, machine learning, and big data. Cluster 2025 solicits high-quality original work advancing the state-of-the-art in clusters and related fields.

## Topics of Interest

# CHIRA 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Computer-Human Interaction Research and Applications (CHIRA) is dedicated to bringing together professionals, academics, and students interested in the advancement of research and practical applications in Computer-Human Interaction. # CDVE 2025: Call for Papers

The **Cooperative Design, Visualization, and Engineering (CDVE) 2025** conference will be held in **Bangkok, Thailand**, from **October 19-22, 2025**, hosted by the School of Information Technology at King Mongkut's Institute of Technology.

This is the 22nd year of the conference series, which brings together participants from all continents to discuss the state-of-the-art and advances in cooperative design, visualization, engineering, and other cooperative applications. The conference emphasizes face-to-face discussions among participants.

## Special Issue Opportunity

CDVE2025 will feature a special issue on the **IEEE Systems, Man, and Cybernetics Magazine** titled "Advance in cooperative design, visualization, engineering, and other cooperative applications." The call for papers for CDVE2025 has been extended by two weeks to accommodate authors interested in this special issue. Further details can be found [here](https://www.ieeesmc.org/technical-activities/human-machine-systems/visual-analytics-and-communication/).

## Keynote Speaker

**Prof. Jaime Lloret** from the Polytechnic University of Valencia will deliver a keynote speech on "Intelligent collaborative sensor networks for Precision Agriculture." Prof. Lloret is recognized as one of the top 2% of scientists worldwide and has an extensive publication record.

## Invitation to Submit Papers

The conference invites submissions of original papers from a broad range of areas related to cooperative design, cooperative visualization, and cooperative engineering. This includes topics encompassing multiple users, locations, or sensors, multimodal cooperation, integration in engineering, social networks, IoT, sensor networks, e-health care, and e-education.

More details can be found on the [call for paper page](calls.html).

## Topics of Interest

*   Cooperative Design
*   Cooperative Visualization
*   Cooperative Engineering
*   Multiple users, locations, or sensors
*   Multimodal cooperation and integration in engineering
*   Social networks
*   IoT
*   Sensor networks
*   E-health care
*   E-education

*   **Contribution Types:** Accepted papers include full papers and short papers.
*   **Submission:** Papers should be submitted via EasyChair. The contact email for submissions is `cdve2025@easychair.org`.
*   **Deadlines:** While specific deadlines are not listed in this section, authors are encouraged to check the `calls.html` page for the most up-to-date information, noting the two-week extension for the special issue.

## Publication and Indexing

    *   MathSciNet

## Registration

CDVE2025 registration is open. Early registration is encouraged. Please visit the [registration page](RegistrationACHI25.html) to register.

*   **Technical Sponsor:** Visual Analytics and Communication Technical Committee (IEEE SMC)
*   **Proceedings Publisher:** Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)

# Call for Papers: IEEE International Conference on Cybernetics and Intelligent Systems (CIS) 2025

The 2025 IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics (SMC) is the flagship conference of the IEEE Systems, Man, and Cybernetics Society. # HotMobile 2025: Call for Papers

The Twenty-sixth International Workshop on Mobile Computing Systems and Applications (ACM HotMobile 2025) will be held on **February 26-27, 2025**, in **Palm Springs, CA**.

HotMobile continues the series of highly selective, interactive workshops focused on mobile applications, systems, and environments, as well as their underlying state-of-the-art technologies. Its small workshop format makes it ideal for presenting and discussing new directions or controversial approaches.

## Focus

HotMobile seeks submissions of papers that (1) focus primarily on systems and applications and (2) propose new directions of research, advocate non-traditional approaches to old (or new) ideas, or generate controversy and discussion. The program committee will explicitly favor early work and papers likely to stimulate reflection and discussion over a "6-pages conference paper."

## Topics of Interest

# IEEE International Conference on Cloud Engineering (IC2E) 2025: Call for Papers

The IEEE International Conference on Cloud Engineering (IC2E) is a premier conference on Cloud Computing, offering a high-quality and comprehensive forum for researchers and practitioners.

## Focus Areas

This year, IC2E 2025 will place a special focus on **cloud systems for sustainability** and **sustainability of cloud systems**, while other topics related to cloud engineering remain welcome.

## Submission Tracks

Authors can choose to submit their papers under either the **Research and Vision Track** or the **Industry and Experience Track**.

## Topics of Interest (Non-Exhaustive List)

*   Sustainability concerns on all levels of the Cloud stack and on all parts of Cloud systems
*   Cloud systems for sustainability, e.g., sustainable Cloud systems for environment modeling and monitoring
*   Cloud management and engineering, from single (micro-)services to complete system landscapes
*   Cloud applications, ranging from the Internet of Things (IoT) over Big Data to Machine Learning
*   Cloud systems, including storage, data distribution, and serverless computing
*   Cloud security and privacy concerns on all levels of the Cloud stack
*   Fog and Edge Computing, and all other system types in the Cloud-Edge Compute Continuum
*   Everything as a Service
*   Non-technical aspects of Cloud Computing, e.g., Cloud governance or cloud economics

## Paper Types

*   **Research papers:** Describe original well-evaluated research. Novelty is a key criterion.
*   **Vision papers:** Describe speculative but well-reasoned and inspiring papers. Focus is on insights and clarity of vision.
*   **Industry and experience papers:** Describe how existing research has been transferred into practice. Focus is on lessons learned.

*Note: Vision papers should have "(Vision Paper)" as a subtitle on the first page.*

## Submission Instructions

*   Paper submissions are **single-blind**.
*   Submit full and short papers in **PDF format** via the Web submission form: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ic2e2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ic2e2025)
*   Select either the **Research Track** or **Industry Track** option.
*   Use the **IEEE Manuscript Template for Conference Proceedings** for formatting.
    *   **LaTeX users:** Use \documentclass[10pt,conference]{IEEEtran}, without including the compsoc or compsocconf options.
*   **Formatting for Reviewing vs. Final Version:**
    *   **Full papers:** Max 9 double-column pages (excluding references) for reviewing; max 12 double-column pages (including everything) for the final version.
    *   **Short papers:** Max 5 pages (excluding references) for reviewing; max 8 pages (including everything) for the final version. Clearly mark as short papers in the title.

IC2E supports Open Science practices; authors are strongly encouraged to publish software and data sets as open-source/data.

## Review Process and Publication

*   All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed based on correctness, originality, technical strength, significance, quality of presentation, and relevance.
*   Submitted manuscripts must contain original contributions and must not be under consideration elsewhere.
*   Accepted papers will be published by the IEEE Computer Society Conference Publishing Services (EI indexed).
*   The author list registered in Easychair at the time of submission **cannot be changed** in the final manuscript.
*   Papers with AI-generated text/images (e.g., from ChatGPT) are prohibited unless explicitly identified.
*   IC2E 2025 is planned as an **in-person event**. Authors of accepted papers are expected to present their papers in person.

## Important Dates

*   **Full and short paper submission deadline:** May 8th, 2025 (AoE, firm deadline)
*   **Author notification and start of shepherding phase:** June 23rd, 2025

# HPDC 2025: Call for Papers

The 34th ACM International Symposium on High-Performance Parallel and Distributed Computing (HPDC) is scheduled for **July 20-23, 2025**, in **Notre Dame, IN, USA**.

## Overview

HPDC is the premier annual conference for presenting the latest research on the design, implementation, evaluation, and use of parallel and distributed systems for high-end computing. HPDC 2025 welcomes submissions of papers, posters, workshop and tutorial proposals, and award nominations.

## Scope and Topics

Submissions are welcomed on high-performance parallel and distributed computing (HPDC) topics including but not limited to: clouds, clusters, grids, big data, massively multicore, and extreme-scale computing systems. Experience reports of operational deployments that provide significantly novel insights for future research on HPDC applications and systems are also welcome.

In the context of high-performance parallel and distributed computing, the topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Datacenter, HPC, cloud, serverless, and edge/IoT computing platforms
*   Heterogeneous computing accelerators and non-volatile memory systems
*   File and storage systems, I/O, and data management
*   Operating systems and networks
*   System software and middleware for parallel and distributed systems
*   Programming languages and runtime systems
*   Big data stacks and big data ecosystems
*   Scientific applications, algorithms, and workflows
*   Resource management and scheduling
*   Performance modeling, benchmarking, and engineering
*   Fault tolerance, reliability, and availability
*   Operational guarantees, risk assessment, and management
*   Energy efficiency and sustainability
*   AI topics, which must relate to parallel and distributed computing systems
*   Novel post-Moore computing technologies including neuromorphic, brain-inspired computing, and quantum computing

HPDC welcomes submissions that utilize AI to enhance the above topics of interest or that utilize distributed systems to enhance AI frameworks, but it is essential that an HPDC submission must address and articulate its connection with parallel and distributed computing research.

## Important Dates (AoE)

*   **Paper Submission Deadline (Technical Papers):** February 6, 2025 (Firm)
*   **Poster Submission Deadline:** March 13, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance (Technical Papers):** April 4, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance (Posters):** April 7, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Version (Technical Papers):** May 1, 2025

## Paper Submission Categories

Submissions to HPDC can be made in one of the following two categories:

1.  **Regular papers:** The primary focus should be to describe new research ideas supported by experimental implementation and evaluation. Authors are strongly encouraged to open-source their software or hardware artifacts.
2.  **Open-source tools and data papers:** The primary focus should be to describe the design, development, and evaluation of new open-source tools or novel data sources.

Submissions in both categories will be evaluated to the same standards in terms of novelty, scientific value, demonstrated usefulness, and potential impact on the field. The chosen category at the time of the submission cannot be changed after the submission deadline.

Authors are required to indicate the category of the paper as a part of the submitted manuscript's title. The last line of the title should indicate the paper type by using one of the two phrases: **"Paper Type: Regular"** or **"Paper Type: Open-source tools and data paper"**.

## ACM Publication

Papers accepted and presented at HPDC 2025 will be published in the ACM Digital Library at no additional cost to the authors.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors are invited to submit technical papers of at most **11 pages** in PDF format, excluding references.
*   Accepted papers will have the flexibility to use an additional page in the camera-ready version to incorporate feedback from the reviewers.
*   Papers should be formatted in the ACM Proceedings Style (using `sigconf` from https://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template).
*   Submissions must be original work that has not appeared in and is not under consideration for another conference or a journal.
*   Submit via the conference submission website: [HPDC Submission Site](https://hpdc.sci.utah.edu/hpdc2025/calls.html).

## Anonymizing Submissions

HPDC uses **dual-anonymous reviewing**. Avoid identifying yourself or your institution explicitly or by implication (e.g., through references or acknowledgments). The first page should use the paper ID assigned during registration in place of the author names.

Use care in referring to your own related work. Do not omit references to your prior work, as this would make it difficult for reviewers to place your submission in its proper context. Instead, reference your past work in the third person, just as you would any other piece of related work. If your submission extends a previous workshop paper or relates to a submission currently under review, cite the other work anonymously and email the deanonymized work to the PC chairs.

If your submission reports on experiences with a system at your institution, refer to the system anonymously but describe the properties needed to evaluate the work. Tool/data papers should also adhere to the double-blind submission policy. If the described tool/dataset framework is already widely used, consider describing it using a different name and not sharing the open-source code repository in the paper.

## arXiv Submission Policy

Having an arXiv paper does not prohibit submission to HPDC 2025. arXiv papers are not peer-reviewed and do not count as prior work. Authors are not expected to compare against arXiv papers that have not formally appeared in previous conference or journal proceedings. If a submitted paper is already on arXiv, please follow the double-blind submission guidelines. Authors are encouraged to use preventive measures to reduce the chances of accidental breach of anonymity (e.g., use a different title in the submission and do not upload/revise the arXiv version during the review period).

## HPDC Policy on the use of AI

HPDC permits the use of AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Grammarly) for language rectification. Authors must verify the accuracy of AI-generated content, and are solely responsible for the paper's contents. AI tools are not eligible for authorship.

The use of any AI-generated text must be disclosed in the acknowledgments section, citing the AI system used. The acknowledgments section should still follow the dual-anonymous submission guideline.

## Contact PC Chairs

*   Ivona Brandić (ivona.brandic@tuwien.ac.at)
*   Robert Wisniewski (bobww123@gmail.com)

# HotOS XX: Call for Papers and Discussions

The 20th Workshop on Hot Topics in Operating Systems (HotOS XX) will bring together researchers and practitioners in computer systems to engage in lively discussions on the principles and practices of building systems software. The workshop aims to present new ideas and debate future research agendas in systems research.

## Submission Types

*   **Position Papers:** Propose new directions of systems research, advocate innovative approaches to long-standing problems, or report on deep insights gained from experience with real-world systems. The program committee will favor papers likely to stimulate reflection and discussion.
*   **Panels and Events:** These may have various formats to inspire lively discussion and research direction-setting. Proposals should describe the topic, format, and length (up to 90 minutes).

## Topics of Interest

HotOS takes a broad view of systems research, including but not limited to:

*   Operating systems
*   Storage
*   Distributed systems
*   Mobile and embedded systems
*   Virtualization
*   Programming languages
*   Networking
*   Security
*   Dependability
*   Manageability
*   New systems contributions influenced by:
    *   Hardware design
    *   Training and serving machine learning
    *   Verification
    *   Economics
    *   Social organization
    *   Biological or other nontraditional computing systems

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Research and Position Papers:**
    *   Maximum **5 pages** including figures and tables, plus as many pages as needed for references.
    *   Text formatted according to ACM's formatting conventions with **10-point font** (two columns, 8.5x11-inch paper, 10-point Times Roman or Libertine font on 12-point leading, 0.75-inch margins, 0.33-inch gutter).
    *   **Double-blind submission:** Authors must anonymize their submissions and refrain from identifying themselves explicitly or by implication.
    *   Pages should be numbered.
    *   Figures and tables should be legible when printed or displayed in black and white.
    *   Use the `acmart` style (`\documentclass[sigconf,10pt]{acmart}`).
    *   Submissions not meeting criteria will be rejected without review.
*   **Panel and Event Proposals:**
    *   Maximum **1-page proposal** (using the same format as papers).
    *   Need not be anonymous (i.e., may be single blind).
    *   Evaluated based on relevance of topic and potential to engage the audience.

## Submission Process

*   Research and position papers as well as panel proposals must be received by **Thursday, January 15, 2025 (AoE)**. This is a hard deadline.
*   Submit as PDF files via the web submission form: [https://hotos25.hotcrp.com/](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://hotos25.hotcrp.com/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1726851695132824&usg=AOvVaw3SrvjPqf9j2_vpsyLZn0NL)
*   Select your submission type on the form (paper or proposal).

## Important Dates

*   **Paper or Panel Proposal Submission Deadline:** January 15, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Author Notifications:** April 1, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Deadline:** April 15, 2025
*   **Workshop:** May 14–16, 2025

## Publication and Presentation

*   Revised versions of all accepted papers will be available online to registered attendees before the workshop.
*   After the workshop, accepted papers, presentation slides, and discussion summaries will be made available on the workshop site.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper is expected to present it and participate in the discussion.
*   HotOS will be an in-person workshop. In extreme cases (e.g., visa issues), alternatives may be considered upon contacting the chairs.

## Registration

*   Registration will be limited to encourage deeper discussion.
*   At least two authors per accepted paper will receive invitations to attend.
*   A registration process to request an invitation will be announced for non-authors, students, and industry practitioners.

## Policies

*   **Anonymity:** Submissions must be anonymized following the double-blind review process. Failure to do so may result in rejection.
*   **Simultaneous Submission/Plagiarism:** Prohibited and subject to ACM's policies.
*   **ORCID ID:** Authors must obtain an ORCID ID for the publishing process.
*   **ACM Publications Policies:** Authors are subject to all ACM Publications Policies, including those on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects.

## Contact

For further information, contact workshop organizers at [hotos25-oc@lists.uwaterloo.ca](mailto:hotos25-oc@lists.uwaterloo.ca).
